sub_topic: Probability of a certain type of travel outcome occurring on a trip
message_1: A group of 10 friends are planning to take a road trip. The probability of their car getting a flat tire during the trip is 0.2. What is the probability that their car will not get a flat tire during the entire trip?
message_2:
The probability of the car not getting a flat tire is the complement of the probability of it getting a flat tire. 

Probability of not getting a flat tire = 1 - Probability of getting a flat tire

Probability of not getting a flat tire = 1 - 0.2 = 0.8

So, the probability that their car will not get a flat tire during the entire trip is 0.8 or 80%.
